channel.title: { Waldemar Wosiński }
channel.description: Blog of Waldemar Wosiński. Topics are: IT, hardware, OS, programming (mostly Scala) and life.

item.title: Successful Scala.js usage in HMRC
item.description: During my contract with HMRC (UK tax institution) in web tax calculator was used ScalaJS tax calculator engine.

item.title: How docker helps with jekyll setup
item.description: Firsly I’ll describe how hard it was and later what was used instead.

item.title: My desired working styles
item.description: I would like to get accurate offers that make sense to my profile. To help you with that please read those working styles:

item.title: Second life of a smartphone
item.description: Let say you change smartphones quite often. Instead of throwing away your mobile consider to use it along with your PC/Laptop/Tablet.

item.title: Europe culture suffers without a common language
item.description: In theory, the European Union has a common language - English. But in practice, there is no common language for European culture.

item.title: Hidden benefits from opensource
item.description:
From open source benefits also people who buy propertiary products

On a free market, the price is determined on competitiveness. If there is none the price is high. Top products can have higher price only for that rate they are better from the competition. If the difference from that price is too high then the competition has a possibility to grow.

item.title: There is no ideal OS for a programmer
item.description: There is no ideal OS for a programmer, for work and for home.

item.title: Saving laptop battery on multi-core CPUs
item.description:
Who could benefit from this article

If you have multi-core x86 CPU(most of intel/amd CPUs) and windows 7+ operating system and you are not happy with your “work on battery time” then this may interest you.
